thread.title: Viewers slam Leanne Battersby's huge newborn on Corrie
thread.title_full: Viewers slam Leanne Battersby's huge newborn on Corrie

title: Viewers slam Leanne Battersby's huge newborn on Corrie
text: Share this article Share However things soon go awry for Leanne, as her waters break while stuck in a lift with Toyah, played by Georgia Taylor - who is then forced to deliver the baby following instructions from nurses outside the broken lift doors. The birth soon becomes tense as the blonde voices her worries of a miscarriage - shrieking that the 'same that happened to Michelle, is going to happen to me.' Heartbreak: The scene was set to be emotional as it saw Leanne give birth to Steve McDonald's child- just hours after he scattered the ashes of his lost baby with his wife Michelle (above) Complications: However things soon go awry for Leanne, as her waters break while stuck in a lift with Toyah, played by Georgia Taylor (R) Fearful: The birth soon becomes tense as the blonde voices her worries of a miscarriage - shrieking that the 'same that happened to Michelle, is going to happen to me' Yet with the support of the brunette, a healthy baby boy is soon delivered, with Leanne fighting back tears as she gushes over her newborn, whispering: 'We did it.' Despite the joyous event being played out, viewers were instead left in outrage over the unrealistic size of the child used as her newborn. Taking to Twitter, one disgruntled fan of the soap wrote: 'Jeez, Leanne's baby was born ready for its first day at school!' before adding '#bigbaby' (sic) Another firmly agreed, adding on the lightning speed of the birth: 'Leanne gave birth to a 3 month old baby like she was shelling a pea.' Welcome to the world: Yet with the support of the brunette, a healthy baby boy is soon delivered, with Leanne fighting back tears as she gushes over her newborn Frenzy: Despite the joyous event being played out, viewers were instead left in outrage over the unrealistic size of the child used as her newborn Flaw: A fellow viewer also noted that the baby also did not appear to have an umbilical cord Observant: Meanwhile another noted the size of the baby made sense when compared with the actress' bizarre walk that had caught attention last year Others added to the fray, commenting: 'That is the biggest new born baby ever' and 'Coooor Leanne's baby was like a 2-year-old' (sic) A fellow viewer also noted that the baby also did not appear to have an umbilical cord in another flaw, writing: 'Wow didn't leanne do well giving birth! No umbilical cord either!' Meanwhile another wrote: 'No wonder Leanne walked like that during pregnancy giving birth to a baby that size!' - in light of the actress' bizarre walk that had caught attention last year. Leanne had amused viewers during her pregnancy in December, after fans labelled her over the top pregnancy waddle 'hilariously odd'. Viewers couldn't help mocking the soap star's efforts after Friday night's episode, with one tweeting: 'What the heck??? Why is Leanne walking like there's a barrel between her legs?' Weird: Leanne had amused viewers during her pregnancy in December, after fans labelled her over the top pregnancy waddle 'hilariously odd' Struggling: A fellow Coronation Street resident watched on as Leanne bizarrely waddled with her huge belly and bags 'Why is Leanne walking so weirdly in #CoronationStreet? I know she's meant to be pregnant but that's ridiculous,' commented another user on Twitter. One included several crying-laughing emojis to their post: 'Leanne's pregnancy walk is getting more and more hilariously odd?! What is happening?! Please!!!' A fan who's had experience with pregnancy said: 'Now I've been pregnant twice and twice the size of Leanne and never have I walked like that, Is she okay?' 'I have seen quite a few pregnant ladies walking around in my time but I have never seen anyone walk like Leanne,' added another. Leanne waddles up the street with her shopping bags, but she seems to be having some problems with lugging both her shopping and her pregnant belly around and ends up over exaggerating her walk Actress Jane, who is mother to two sons herself, recently spoke to WhatsonTV about the experience of giving birth on-screen. Despite having given birth herself however, she admitted that doing it as an actress was strangely 'exhausting' in comparison - and is far more challenging thanks to the endless dialogue. She said: 'I've never given birth on screen before although I've done it twice in real life. It was weirdly exhausting. 'Leanne is terrified, it’s technically difficult and there’s a lot of dialogue, which isn’t usually the case for the person giving birth.' As she wraps up the chit chat, Leanne heads off up the cobbles but she takes extremely wide steps that viewers found hilarious Viewers were in hysterics over Leanne Battersby's funny pregnancy waddle, asking why it was so over the top Leanne Battersby, played by Jane Danson (left), is currently pregnant with Steve McDonald's baby in Coronation Street. She's caught up in a love triangle with her ex Peter Barlow (right played by Chris Gascoyne)
